subsc: General finance sector,General industry and trade sector,Other social services,Banking,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project (SAL) will support the government's structural
            adjustment program, which is designed to: (a) reform the
            public sector to improve its efficiency and strengthen
            fiscal policies; (b) improve incentives for greater export
            orientation and private sector activity; (c) strengthen
            competitiveness of private financial institutions and
            prudential supervision of the financial system; and (d)
            increase coverage and efficiency of social programs, and
            reform the pension system. The SAL will support the
            following set of reforms: (1) maintenance of a macroeconomic
            framework to ensure continued stability; (w) public sector
            reform to: (i) privatize government services and
            enterprises, (ii) reduce public sector employment, (iii)
            improve the budget process, and (iv) rationalize and expand
            the tax base; (3) trade reforms to: (i) reduce the level of
            protection, (ii) remove price and profit margin contols,
            (iii) strengthen regulatory framework for public utilities,
            and (iv) improve export incentives; (4) financial sector
            reforms to: (i) reduce discrimination against private
            financial institutions, (ii) limit subsidized credit, (iii)
            strengthen prudential supervision, and (iv) demonopolize the
            insurance sector; and (5) social sector reforms to: (i)
            improve targeting and coverage of social programs, (ii)
            strengthen programs to retrain displaced public sector
            employees; and (iii) reform the pension system to improve
            equity and solvency.
